DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study is to find out whether AIC316 is safe and efficacious for the prevention of reactivation of genital herpes
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study for a New Antiviral Drug to Treat Genital Herpes Type 2
DOC.criteria: Adult, Immunocompetent men and women in good health of any ethnic group History of recurrent episodes of genital herpes for at least 12 months Seropositive for Herpes Simplex Virus HSV Type 2 Body Mass Index (BMI) between 18 and 35 kg/m2 Present episode of genital herpes Intake of systemic drug against HSV or any topical application against HSV within 7 days before randomization for the trial Intake of systemic corticosteroids, other immunomodulating agents or any investigational agent within 3 months before randomization for the trial Positive results in any of the virology tests for human immunodeficiency virus antibody (HIVAb), hepatitis C antibody (HCVAb), hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) or hepatitis B core antibody (HBcAb)
